website_summaries.verdict: Comb offers plenty of versatility, as it has different teeth on both sides of the handle.
pros: Provides a good value, as it has 2 combs in one, with a grooming comb and a flea comb
Narrow teeth on the flea comb side will successfully capture adult insects and eggs
Handle has a soft cover to make it comfortable to use
cons: Doesn't seem to work as well on larger dogs as it does on puppies and small breeds

customer_reviews.title: It's small enough and does the job but be careful to not leave it for chewing on!
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect size for my teacup 4lb Morkie - that said, don't let your dog chew on it or get a hold of it - the purple cover on the handle is like a soft rubber material and comes apart in pieces that they can swallow. My mistake as I left it on the floor and found out the hard way! I recommend it as it really meets the needs for combing the face especially. I like the bristle brush (the matching one) for the coat, body and fluffing him!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren T.

customer_reviews.title: I love this comb
customer_reviews.text: I love this small comb for dogs because I have a Shih Tzu. They are a double-coated dog and whose hair grows long and flows. These dogs need to be groomed each day if you allow their hair to grow out naturally to where they have a topnotch, mustache and beard as well as the long, fluffy body coat. I use this comb for her face for combing the beard, mustache and topnotch. This is a perfect tool to comb up near the eyes in order to keep the mustache clean around the eyes. I simply love and recommend this great tool to people who own double coated dogs, particularly dogs that have a mustache that is allowed to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Hecate

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to measurements!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and is exactly what I was looking for...just a miniature version of what I was looking for. I did not pay attention to the measurements and it was much smaller than I expected, but that certainly was not their fault. It is a good product and it is actually great for my little malti-poo's face. The only flaw is that it is truly miniature...and while our dogs may be miniature, that doesn't mean our hands are, and even the handle is quite tiny (and I have little hands), so this would probably be difficult for someone with larger, or even average-sized, hands to use.
customer_reviews.author: Donnelle

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best comb for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best comb for a small dog. The wide teeth do a good job for the first brush through, and the smaller teeth glide easily trough to catch any fine sand or fleas that might be present in her coat. I wouldn't recommend it for a large dog unless you want to spend all day combing. And I'm not sure how it would work for "fluffy" coats. My terrier mix has short silky hair so it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Great dog comb
customer_reviews.text: I must admit I was doubtful this would work on my YorkiePoo. I tried the wide side first since I didn’t dream his hair would go through the small side. It glides through so easy it didn’t do very good on the mats. I decided what the heck and tried the smaller side and it worked like a charm. In just a few minutes I had all his hair fully combed out and he looked great.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: This comb is TINY!
customer_reviews.text: So the comb is minuscule, and when I get it I see a “perfect for puppies and TOY breeds”. I ran to check if it was my bad but this was not obviously stated. UPDATE: I am updating just an hour after posting the first part. The comb is tiny indeed, but it is a really nice comb, better than ones I’ve owned in the past. I guess it’ll take me a little longer to comb my pekingese, but I’m keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Majo

customer_reviews.title: Small pocket sized comb ideal for my cat
customer_reviews.text: Having the two sides, wide comb for coat and fine comb for checking for bugs, this comb is the perfect companion. Its size means its easy to carry around in your pocket. I have a Persian cat so combing is a daily routine, having this able to keep in your pocket means its easily available when the cat is ready or in my lap, saves having to find the comb then find the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Scotamazon

customer_reviews.title: short little comb
customer_reviews.text: This is much shorter than my last flea comb though I do like that their are 2 different sizes, one on each side but wish it was a little longer as my 3 lb yorkie has very thin long hair and I need to use a very fine tooth comb on her instead of a brush. I do use a brush on my 8 lb yorkie as she has very long thick hair. I use the comb to get the mats out of her and a longer comb would work better
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L. Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: So small
customer_reviews.text: I guess I need to work on my math, this is so small, not sure what uses it is good for? Well, at least it won't be good for my Cavachon. It is built sturdy, but if your looking for a medium size comb this one is not it! LOL I gave it a three because I can't believe this is a thing...I guess if I had a barbie it would be useful?
customer_reviews.author: Gary Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s a good little starter comb. It’s not harsh in her coat (Yorkie pup) and doesn’t scratch her skin. We’re both still adjusting as this is the first small and “hairy” dog I’ve ever had (only pitties in the past) so it’s been trial’n error for me and she’s getting used to being groomed, but I would definitely recommend this comb to start out with.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: A must have for grooming
customer_reviews.text: My dog prefers her brush and doesn’t like that this comb pulls a little, but it does a really good job keeping mats away. Also, when we do get a mat, we stick the comb in under the mat next to her skin to protect her delicate skin from the scissors. We also use it around her eyes to get what we call goobers out of the fur after cleaning them. Also great for parting fur for flea prevention cream.
customer_reviews.author: VikkiB

customer_reviews.title: Great Comb for Small Puppies
customer_reviews.text: This comb was a little smaller than I expected, but it is working well for my 7 lb. cockapoo puppy. I’ve been using the small side to comb her face and her poodle runny eyes, and the larger side to comb out her legs and body. I comb her everyday. She still has her puppy fur, so I don’t know if it will continue to work with a thick wavy adult coat, but it will always be the go to comb for her face.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn G

customer_reviews.title: good, sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work "food, drool, and debris" from my Westie's beard. I had been trying to use a slicker brush which was just too big and too unwieldy for the area around his mouth. This tool works well. I use the larger comb first to get out any big clump or tangles then go through with the finer comb. The grip is comfortable and fits well in my small hand. (It's only about 4.75" long.) I also like that the ends of the teeth are round, not pointed. That makes me feel a little better on the days when the Westie doesn't want to sit still.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: My favorite comb for small long-haired breeds.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect comb for my small, long-haired Mi-ki dogs. It fits easily in my purse so I'm always ready for a touchup. The fine-tooth side is nearly as good as a flea comb for removing eye gunk. The handle is comfortable in my hand. The tines are rounded at the ends so they don't scratch. I've bought several of these so I can grab one whenever I need it.
customer_reviews.author: MsMary

customer_reviews.title: Repeat purchase, perfect for my rabbit
customer_reviews.text: I misplaced this exact same model and loved it so much that I purchased it again. I use it for an English Angora, and it's fantastic for grooming him, the dual edge is wonderful. Great product line overall, I use the slicker brush and some other items, as well. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: KBLicious

customer_reviews.title: Great Comb for  small dogs
customer_reviews.text: I actually have 3 of these combs. They work great for small dogs. I have a 5 lb yorkie & use it to get the stuff out from around her eyes. She doesn't care for grooming & chewed the end of the comb up on one comb.
customer_reviews.author: T Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great comb for a little dog
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this comb is easy to hold. I use the wider teeth initially to comb my dog, and then I go back through with the narrower teeth. I also have a brush, but it doesn’t do as good a job. This comb is able to get everything and she hasn’t had any mats since I started using it. The only downside is that she thinks it’s a toy lol
customer_reviews.author: Atesha

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller breeds
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lil comb for my yorkie. Works great on her small face. This works very well on getting the build up of tear marks. She is only 3.8 pounds and just over all tiny. This works very well for her size. I now also use lil pals slicker brush on her too. Which she loves the brush. Normally she is a big baby and yelps or takes off on me. But lil pals seem to work well for her. I definitely recommend this line for smaller breeds.
customer_reviews.author: The PeanutTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Perfect comb.
customer_reviews.text: This comb is fabulous. After brushing my Poodle baby I use the comb. The fine tooth cleans around eyes and face. The size is so nice. Anything bigger is just impossible on such a little puppy. He never objects to it. Having both sizes of teeth on one comb is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Easier shedding season
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for my ferrets during shedding season. They freak out over the brush I have, but this comb seems to be a lot more comfortable for them because they happily lay down for a treat and combing. Also, the hair can be quickly removed, but stays in the comb until you pull it out so there isn't hair everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Nero

customer_reviews.title: So great I bought two
customer_reviews.text: So great I bought two ! I have a white Havenses puppy , this double sided comb helps get in here eye area great ! I use the wide side for loosening it up after I dampen it with the Art naturals Aloe spray , then the tighter comb side gets in and gets the rest out ! I also use the wider side to tease the hair on her head to stick up fluffy . Actually the comb does the teasing itself ! I love this product . It also gets stuck food out of her beard 🐶
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: rabbit and dog comb
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my bunnies and my dog's face. I have several different ones from this company and love the way that they feel while using. comfortable handle and easy to use on small dogs, large dog faces, and even my bunnies.
customer_reviews.author: Tiptonthebriard

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy to use for your fur pet!
customer_reviews.text: I like the dual comb Brissels on either side which are different in size to comb through the fur on your animal and the grip on it is nice. Overall great product!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Comb
customer_reviews.text: Great little comb. Yes, it is small, but it is sturdy and does the job. I purchased this comb to smooth my ShihTzu's face, head, and ears every morning before going for our walk. He wakes up a mess and this little comb does exactly what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: pinkbutterflies

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a toy poodle!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a tiny comb to use for grooming our toy poodle, and this one works perfectly! We use it a lot for combing her face and ears and other tricky areas that are hard to get with a larger brush.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Handy little tool that works great
customer_reviews.text: This little come works great. I considered buying it several times before I actually did because I thought it was a little high for a calm, but it’s worth it’s weight in gold. Can’t say that my mall Teese is very crazy about it, but it does the trick when coming through her face fur with tear stain “gunkies”
customer_reviews.author: jujubean

customer_reviews.title: I use it every morning
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my 5 lb yorkie. She used to get gook in her eyes. I started using an eye rinse product on her eyes every morning and then used this to comb through near her eyes. She tolerates both well. I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: bjbinfl

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my Havanese!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little comb! My little Have's ears get very matted and this is the perfect comb to get them out! Also got the lilpals de matter. Great combo and price!
customer_reviews.author: gellen62

customer_reviews.title: Really nice little brush- perfect for grooming dog faces!
customer_reviews.text: I have two small dogs and this comb is great to use on them. It's not just because of the size of the comb. It's primarily because of the distance between the tines or teeth. On the side where the tines are closest, it's perfect to use under the eyes to catch any eye discharge. The other side is perfect to use on the rest of their face as it grooms but the tines are not so close together that it pulls any whiskers out. We just got a second one to take to the dog park with us. It's easy to transport due to it's small size and we take it to gets burrs out of our dogs fur.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed for my Maltese puppy. I wanted a small comb that would be less obtrusive so I can get him used to it. The handle makes it easy to hold, too. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: smr61754

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Its Intended Use
customer_reviews.text: This comb is great for grooming my small (12 pound) dog's face. The regular 6" comb I use for the rest of the dog is too large for combing around his eyes, nose, and mouth which definitely needs regular grooming. I use the course comb first then repeat with the very fine comb which is more closely spaced than the fine teeth on my larger comb. I'm not sure how long this comb will last, however. I've not had good longevity with other grooming products except much more expensive tools designed for professional use. However, after 8 months of daily use, this comb is doing fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: David Altekruse

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend This Product
customer_reviews.text: I never thought this little comb would work so great .The same day it arrived,I had my pup on my lap & decided to give it a try & she sat so still as I combed away the gunk from her eyes . Looking forward to using it during her next bath time..
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Made for miniature dogs not small dogs 🐶
customer_reviews.text: The product is great; however, this is brush is for miniature dogs not small dogs. We just got a cavapoo and he is 8 weeks old. Please note He is a medium size and will get up to 20lbs. The brush is already too small for him.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Ephrem

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the tiny breed with a tiny face.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little comb. I have a Maltese and give her facials about 3 times a week and it is perfect to get little eye boogers out of her eyes. Keeps her well-groomed around her face and eyes. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Paula Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little comb for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: This comb is perfect for my two Chihuahua crosses (one Chihuahua Maltese cross and one Chihuahua Pomeranian cross). I use the Conair Dog Soft Slicker to do an overall brushing, and then I use this comb for the hard to get spots such as the feet, face, parts of the legs, etc. The two grooming tools are perfect to keep the two dogs' silky fur well groomed and completely mat free. I have even used it on hard to reach spots on my larger Australian Cattle Dog as part of her grooming as well. I definitely recommend this little grooming comb as a useful addition to grooming kits.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Wren

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: But it works great getting all the shedder off. Her hair is silky smooth after use! The comb has a nice sturdy feel as well. And hey, so what if it takes longer? That just extends quality coifing time which we both enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: RevB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small long haired dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Like someone else on this list, I too have a small Bolognese (long white hair). Have been using this comb on him since he was a puppy (now 17 months). It's the only thing he will tolerate and gets his tangles out. It's great around his snout, ears, eyes and tail, as well as the rest of him. I no longer use the Lil Pals brush, only this comb. Even his groomer said that's all we really need. I'm ordering another one because he got a hold of it one day and chewed off most of the hard rubber handle, but I've been using it for months since that happened and it still fits comfortably in my hands. Extremely durable.
customer_reviews.author: ede19

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful comb if you have a dog with hair
customer_reviews.text: I have a shih tzu, so I have tried quite the variety of groom products over the last 5.5 years. I purchased this one primarily to comb through his beard and mustache and it's the best comb I've used yet! I love that it is double-sided because I can easily switch back and forth while working out mats (all over, not just on his face). It's small (less than 6" long), but a perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Bilodeau (Musings of Madjy)

customer_reviews.title: Combing The Amazon Way
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy, effective comb for tiny pups who have fine, silky hair. It is small, which I like. The handle is comfortable and fits my hand well. It has two sides: one with widely spaced teeth; the teeth on the other side are narrowly spaced. My pup isn't crazy about being combed (she became seriously matted very quickly) but loves to play with the comb. So, she tolerates her grooming because she knows she will be rewarded afterward by allowing her to indulge in "comb" hide and seek. (She is a pro at hiding.) The comb is great; good price.
customer_reviews.author: Beje

customer_reviews.title: Great little comb grooming tool!
customer_reviews.text: This little comb works very well especially for brushing little faces. I use it to get out mats as well. If you use it for mats, know it will not cut them out. U mist hold the hair between the dogs skin and gently work through the mats. I use this almost every day. They are fantastic for a small breed dog, or any dogs face I would imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G.

customer_reviews.title: Best Comb Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect comb for small dogs. The size of this comb is the perfect size for my three Shih Tzus. Big enough for their bodies and small enough for their faces. The larger side is great for getting out tangles and the other side for smoothing out their coat. The handle is very comfortable, too.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Gruett

customer_reviews.title: Cat's didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: It does catch fleas, unfortunately it seems like the cats are being tormented during its use. We just give them flea meds now because the comb seemed to be causing them too much discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: W W

customer_reviews.title: It is very good at keeping the matts out
customer_reviews.text: I use this comb daily on my Maltese/Yorkie puppy. It is very good at keeping the matts out. I like that it has two sides, I use the larger side first over her whole body, and then use the smaller side for her face and paws. She loves it and lays on my lap very relaxed while I comb her, so I know it's not hurting her at all. After combing she looks fresh and fluffy.
customer_reviews.author: Becky H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for tiny dog
customer_reviews.text: We have a 4 pound pomeranian who gets little knots around her ears. Bigger combs are awkward to use and I couldn't get the combs close enough around the ears to pull at the knots. This comb is two-sided with each side providing different tooth spacing. It allows me to gently work at a knot without hurting our dog's sensitive ears. As well, because the comb is smaller, I believe it is less daunting to the dog, when she sees me pulling it out of her grooming basket. She doesn't seem to react as negatively. As well, the comb is sturdy and the rubber grip is comfortable in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Bope

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little comb to use around a dogs face
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little comb to use around a dogs face. I use mine on my ausidoodle's face & beard. It makes keeping him looking nice easier. You do have to be careful since it is sharp, but my baby sits still...so no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Oceanlover118

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: This comb is very tiny and works only on very small dogs to remove matting. I use this along with a bigger comb and a metal brush to groom my Bichpoo puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Priya

customer_reviews.title: WAY TOO SMALL.
customer_reviews.text: If it's ONLY available in one size (Extra Small) then just put that in the description. Nothing about the description made me think it wouldn't work for a normal sized dog, but it won't. It might work wonderful for a hamster.... but it's useless on anything bigger than a gerbil.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tiny Dog Comb
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my Yorkie, YorkiePoo, Morkie and Maltipoo. I use it on their mustaches and by their eyes. It is very gentle and they do not mind that at all. I also use it for the Maltipoo who has very poodle fur. The brush doesn't always get all the curls out and this is great for under his arms etc.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Lee

customer_reviews.title: Small but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a Yorkie. I bought the brush too. My little boy likes it. Very convenient and small enough to put in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Small but great.
customer_reviews.text: I like the comb, size is perfect and it does the job. My dog is not too fond of it, but it helps with keeping her hair intact.
customer_reviews.author: Dante

customer_reviews.title: Now my husband wants me to order him one?
customer_reviews.text: This is a tiny little comb... perfect for getting around the eyes, ears and mustaches of these little dogs! I love it. My husband wants me to order one for his moustache. I'd prefer he wanted me to order him a razor for his moustache, but that ain't happening soon.
customer_reviews.author: KarinTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great for Yorkies!
customer_reviews.text: The wider side of the comb is great for separating mats, and the more compact side is great for finishing up a grooming session. Our dogs look great after using this comb!
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Student

customer_reviews.title: This little brush is great for working at small tangles and even bigger mats
customer_reviews.text: I had been trying to just brush my yorkie/poodle with a slicker brush and, boy, was that a mistake. This little brush is great for working at small tangles and even bigger mats. My dog doesn't mind it as much at the bigger brushes because I have more control over how much it tugs at his skin in sensitive areas. He used to squirm all over the place when I'd get the brushes out and now he's much more cooperative!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect one for the job
customer_reviews.text: I have an 11 pound cockapoo who gets a lot of dried eye gunk in the fur on either side of his muzzle, and the easiest way to get rid of it is to comb it out. It's such a delicate area and he's such a small dog that I needed a very small comb. This is the perfect one for the job. I like that I can go over the area with the wide tooth side, and then switch to the narrow tooth--it really helps reduce painful snags.
customer_reviews.author: Clovis Sangrail

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one of these for a long time and it was getting worn out. So decided it was a time fir a new one. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY SMALL
customer_reviews.text: The actual size of the metal comb part is just 1.5". The total size only 4.5". Maybe good for eyebrows?
customer_reviews.author: My review

customer_reviews.title: Great for Shih Tzu dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday on my Shih Tzu puppy. This works great for tangles in her hair and on her eye area from tear staining. I couldn’t live without this comb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and dual sides. Works well on our dog, cat, and rabbit.
customer_reviews.author: Momma O

customer_reviews.title: We absolutely love this comb
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this comb, have had it now for several years and have used it on 4 different poodles and a powder puff Chinese crested. It's the perfect size to use on small dogs and it's great for getting out tangles. I recommend it constantly to all my friends with pets. I'm ready to order a second so I can keep one in my van for when the dogs travel with me. It's a must have item for any small dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: Momto2 and sometimes the kid

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT LITTLE GROOMING TOOL!
customer_reviews.text: This the best little grooming tool I have ever owned! It's light, easy to handle and leaves "Buddy's" coat looking beautiful. I looked a long time for this after I saw one at my Vet's office. Buddy even dozes off while I am grooming him..and every now and then I hit a spot he cannot reach and his little leg goes like crazy, and yes, Buddy loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little comb that I use on daily basis for my tiny pups.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little comb. It helps me keep my pups' eyes, snouts, paws, etc. areas that get dirty easily and regularly clean all the time with the fine tooth comb side. And, with the wider tooth comb side, I pull out the tiny little fuzz balls that may not be pulled by brushing or using the regular comb on my sweet little maltese girl. My maltipoo boy doesn't let me brush or comb him at all but he does let me clean out around his eyes of mouth or pull out the hitch-hiker weeds from his paws after a walk.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Abshari

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!!!❤
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for my teacup poodle!! I recommend it to anyone with small animals!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Chills

customer_reviews.title: Tiny.  Should have put a picture up with a quarter next to comb for reference.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the picture. Surprised at how small the comb was. I am sure it would work for a cabbage patch doll.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Powered Attorney

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Really works well to clean out my bigger cat's undercoat. He's a short-haired cat but it's amazing how much fur he's got. He's also supersized and sometimes has difficulty reaching his lower back which results in some matting. This tiny comb really does the job and he actually will walk over to me when I show it to him so I know using it makes him feel better.
customer_reviews.author: CatsPaw

customer_reviews.title: Good for tangles!
customer_reviews.text: I used the comb for my dog is very easy to release the tangled fur. I would recommend this product for small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool. I have a toy poodle only 2 1/2 lbs. Small enough for me to use with one hand while holding her with the other. The handle is good doesn’t slip in your hand while using it. The teeth on the comb are good it grabs hair & pull through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Comb for every Situation...
customer_reviews.text: Combing out a Maltese can be a tedious task. You have to find the tangles and knots and then try to, as painlessly as possible, pull them out. With this little comb, which can easily slide into your purse, you have the choice of sides to work the out the mat. It is easy to handle and has a handle that is easy to grip. We use ours several times a week and have been extremely happy with the results. In fact, the more you use it, the less you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Chronarchs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I love this little comb. It is small enough to get in all the tricky areas while grooming your small pet. I love that there are 2 sizes of tines for easily removing the matts and tangles. I have a 7.5 pound Yorkie and his hair tangles fast. This comb is perfect for getting them out without causing pain and discomfort. I love the small size. The handle is comfortable to use and my little guy loves to be groomed now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yorkie puppies loved comb
customer_reviews.text: Both of my puppies actually say in my lap until I got tired of combing. They have never stayed still for combing. I've been working on getting them used to it slowly. This comb brought that to an end. It's also very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sjrbritt

customer_reviews.title: It's a good comb for small breed pet
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect size comb to brush my little poodle's face, ears, and mouth area. He would not let me use a larger comb when brushing him in the face area. It also takes out any tangles and loose fur. It also works as a detangling comb for any area of the body. The rubbery handle makes it easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Rosy

customer_reviews.title: Li'l Pals Extra Small Comb for Dogs is Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Love this comb for my Mini-Poodle. All the other combs are just too big. This is the only comb that my poodle will tolerate especially in sensitive areas. This comb is well-made and will last forever. The double side is good at working out any mats in the coat. The Extra Small brush is great too - very gentle but does the job. I highly recommend these Li'l Pals Grooming products. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Marlene S.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my old, matted black cat. She was covered in big, thick mats. I used to spend hours pulling them out while watching TV. I decided that it was time to get a real comb. Within 30 minutes, they were gone. She didn't like it, but that isn't the comb's fault. (She had MAJOR mats!) It's small, so it doesn't take up a bunch of space, and it fits nicely in your hand. I also like that there are 2 different sides. It helped with the different sized mats. Good product! (especially for the price)
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay not the best
customer_reviews.text: Super small hair brush. Since it’s so small it’s honestly hard to use. It does take out all the knots of my puppies hair though!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lam

customer_reviews.title: Good Brush!
customer_reviews.text: This brush really helps with taking out knots in your dog's fur. The only thing that's difficult is my puppy likes to bite me as I'm brushing her because she thinks it's a toy, but that's unrelated to the brush and closer related to training her...
customer_reviews.author: Susan E

customer_reviews.title: The comb part is great - the handle was a little short to be ...
customer_reviews.text: The comb part is great - the handle was a little short to be comfortable. Kind of like trying to eat with a toddler fork - you could do it, but it doesn't feel quite right in your hand. An extra inch on the handle and this would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the options this little comb provides. I use it on my Yorkie's face starting with the wider teeth and following up with the tighter teeth. It works great at getting the eye crusty's to help keep the eyes clean. Easy to grip and comfortable to use. Great for grooming longer haired small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: denise

customer_reviews.title: Face and finishing
customer_reviews.text: I’m a groomer and I love this comb for faces and finishing. Gets the tiny little knots out and makes faces look so much cleaner and lay much nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: Way too small. Maybe ok if you are 5 years old. Handle too small to comfortably hold. Not even sure who would want a comb this small.
customer_reviews.author: BitoMom

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly sized for tiny dogs
customer_reviews.text: Small comb for very small dogs. Glides easily thru fur . Removes tangles. It did not hurt or bother my dog whatsoever
customer_reviews.author: AmberG

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and useful
customer_reviews.text: This little comb is so cute. It is very small and can be tucked easily into a drawer or travel bag. My dog is 11 pounds and has to go to the groomer to get a haircut every 6-8 weeks. However, in between haircuts the long hair on his ears and tail can get mats, and I use this type of comb to get those out. I use the more closely spaced side of this comb for his ears and the more widely spaced side for his tail, and it works out perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: charecc

customer_reviews.title: Great comb.
customer_reviews.text: We just got a Maltese puppy and the groomer suggested a comb rather than a brush. So I looked at other reviews and found this dual comb. It has been working out really well. Our dog is only 5 lbs so I needed something small. This fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Sandygirl

customer_reviews.title: works nicely on my Chihuahua
customer_reviews.text: Delivered quickly, works nicely on my Chihuahua, although I don't use as a flea comb.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia L. Conradi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Works very well. Can’t complain. Solid product all around. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't remove loose fur
customer_reviews.text: Combs the fur but does not remove loose fur. I can comb and then literally use my hand to pick loose fur off.
customer_reviews.author: Be Kind

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning undereye debris and combing small muzzles!
customer_reviews.text: I use this little comb to clean out from under my dogs' eyes and comb their muzzles. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have Comb for Grooming the Face of Small Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I love how well this double-sided grooming comb works for grooming for my Shih Tzu's face. The size of the teeth and the overall comb are large enough to work on the hair around the eyes and mouth, but small enough so that your dog won't be alarmed or flinch as he might do, if you tried to use a larger comb on his face. It is a tool that I will be happily using every single day.
customer_reviews.author: MKT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Maltipoo puppy
customer_reviews.text: She's barely 3 lbs and just over 3 months old so not very keen on being groomed. This is the perfect size for her. Requires patience to comb small sections at a time and holding the base of the hair if matted. This comb also works very well for her face area. I usually use a larger comb to comb her body, a dematting comb to comb through the worst of the mats and use this comb to fine tune.
customer_reviews.author: S Waugh

customer_reviews.title: great, ty  :)
customer_reviews.text: Great little comb at a good price. ty. I use it on my Maltese's eyebrows. :)
customer_reviews.author: mini schnauzer lovers

customer_reviews.title: This works really well. I was skeptical but it’s fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I was skeptical but it’s fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Just another reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Happy dog owner comb!!
customer_reviews.text: My favorit comb!! Perfect size and 2 sides work for everything!!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Erdelyi

customer_reviews.title: works well for a tiny dog
customer_reviews.text: use this to comb out tangles on my little yorkie mix
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: This comb is great and gets out all of those tiny hair knots on our family Maltese puppy. It will takes some time and effort, but in the end, your pet will have "smoooooth"....and soft hair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect comb for small breeds
customer_reviews.text: I found my baby the perfect little comb! She's a Yorkie and her hair is soft and silky everywhere but around her mouth. For the longest time I tried brushing it with her pin brush, but she squirms every time she sees it coming at her face. I'm so happy to finally find something that works! She doesn't mind it because it's small, and I can get through her tangles quickly. I love this comb!
customer_reviews.author: LV4NMLSTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold and use
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. I had one for my previous dog and find it very useful.
customer_reviews.author: E Jean Graham

customer_reviews.title: Small buy
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t expecting it to be so small but perfect for when I get the gunk out of my puppy eyes
customer_reviews.author: Sherita

customer_reviews.title: Love! Perfect for eye debris
customer_reviews.text: I love this comb! Wish I had it years ago with my 3 lb yorkie. It is perfect for my shoodle's head, especially under eyes for cleaning/grooming. Small size makes it perfect and so easy to use with less nervousness from my pup. It would be great for any sized dog that needs face grooming.
customer_reviews.author: JC Florida Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for small dogs and tight spots
customer_reviews.text: I use this comb on my 7-lb. Maltese and it doesn't bother her nearly as much as when I use full-size combs because it grabs less hair in one stroke. It's great for combing the beard or around the eyes. I'm guessing it would be a more nimble way to catch fleas than with a large flea comb; fortunately, I haven't needed it for that. It seems well made and has a nice grip.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Li'l Pals Double-sided purple and green grooming comb for dogs, extra small
customer_reviews.text: This little comb is perfect for my 6# yorkie. He gets alot of mats around his eyes and face and this little comb gets it out easily. The size is perfect for a toy breed. I would not recommend this for a larger size dog. Probably for any toy breed under 10#s. It seems very sturdy and the price is very reasonable. So far it is the perfect grooming comb around the face.
customer_reviews.author: HK fan

customer_reviews.title: Great service and packaging
customer_reviews.text: Great service and packaging. The only problem I have with the comb is the size of the handle. I have small dogs/puppies bit am a normal sized human. The handle falls out of my hands a lot and I lose control of the grooming session.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to miss in packaging
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived with several others. I almost lost it in the packaging. Exactly what I wanted, though! I am bringing home a 5lb. Shihtzu. This little comb is exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

product_meta.title: LilPals Double-Sided Dog Comb, Green
product_meta.description: Size:1-PackThe LI'L PALS Double-Sided Dog Comb is designed to untangle and smooth the coat. LI'L PALS Double-Sided Dog Combs are scaled down to the perfect proportion and easy to grip. LI'L PALS dog grooming tools are perfect for puppies and toy breeds, and encourage a stronger bond between the owner and pet.
feature_bullets: PUPPY DOG COMB: Use the LI'L PALS Double-Sided Comb everyday for fun and exercise
DOG BRUSHES FOR GROOMING: Made of stainless steel and features closely spaced teeth to lift out fleas and burs
PET BRUSHES & COMBS: Helps remove mats and tangles
DOG GROOMING BRUSH: To use this dog comb, begin combing with the wider spaced teeth until the comb runs smoothly through the coat and always remember to comb in the direction of hair growth
LI'L PALS: This collection provides just the right fit for petite dogs by offering smaller sizes of grooming products
Age Range Description: All Life Stages
Best suited for puppies and toy breeds
Brush with long strokes in the direction of the hair growth
Brushing distributes natural oils, leaving a shiny, healthy coat
Lifts out loose hair and debris
Perfect for use with Ill Pals Slicker Brush
